abstracts.cdata!:
Despite a decade of sweeping health care
            reforms and high per capita health spending, Argentina
            entered the 21st century with nearly one-third of its
            population lacking secure access to basic health care. By
            moving from a traditional system based on inputs and fixed
            budgets to one geared around outputs and results, Plan Nacer
            has given beneficiaries more influence on service providers
            , enhanced transparency; increased accountability of all
            actors in the system; and improved public performance and
            productivity. Drawing upon International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) funding and expertise
            since 2002, Argentina has delivered health insurance and
            secure access to health services to more than one million
            uninsured pregnant women and children, and has helped drive
            immunization rates up to 94 percent.
